text.front:
EUROPHYSICS LETTERS
15 October 1997
Europhys. Lett., 40 (2), pp. 153-158 (1997)
Microscopic dynamics in liquid deuterium:
A transition from collective to single-particle regimes
M. Mukherjee 1 , F. J. Bermejo 1 , B. Fåk 2 and S. M. Bennington 3
1 Instituto de Estructura de la Materia, Consejo Superior de Investigaciones Científicas
Serrano 123, E-28006 Madrid, Spain
2 Département de Recherche Fondamentale sur la Matière Condensée, SPSMS/MDN
CEA Grenoble
-38054 Grenoble, France
3 Rutherford Appleton Laboratory -Chilton,
Didcot Oxon, OX11 0QX, UK
( received 16 June 1997; accepted 9 September 1997 )
PACS. 62.10+s -Mechanical properties of liquids.
PACS. 62.60+v -Acoustical properties of liquids.
Abstract. -
Well-defined (propagating) collective density fluctuations are found for liquid
deuterium up to large wave vectors at SVP conditions. Their phase velocities as well as
the wave vector dependence of the excitation linewidths and strengths indicate that what is
experimentally observed is dominated by a continuation to large wave vectors of hydrodynamic
(sound-mode) excitations. For wave vectors 2.3 ≤ Q ≤ 4Å
−1 , the spectrum approaches that
of a weakly interacting fluid. A transition to a regime dominated by single-particle (recoil and
quantized rotation) motions is found to occur within 4.2 ≤ Q ≤ 4.5Å
−1 , depending upon
thermodynamic conditions.
c Les Editions de Physique
